agrinova_description: AgriNova is an innovative agriculture support platform designed to connect farmers, donors, and investors. It provides direct access to funding, investment opportunities, crop management tools, and government schemes.
farmer_support: Farmer Support - Direct access to donations, investments, and retailers.
donor_investor: Donor & Investor Collaboration - Supporting and funding profitable agriculture projects.
machine_learning: Machine Learning - AI-driven crop recommendations and price estimations.
marketplace: Livestock & Product Marketplace - Helping farmers find essential agricultural resources.
gov_schemes: Government Schemes & Training - Providing information on subsidies and farming practices.
mission_description: To empower farmers, encourage sustainable agriculture, and connect stakeholders in a seamless digital ecosystem.
developer_info: This project was developed by students from PSG Polytechnic College as part of their Diploma in Computer Engineering program under the guidance of Ms. P. Thilakaveni.
flutter: Flutter & Dart - For a smooth cross-platform mobile experience.
firebase: Firebase Firestore - Secure cloud-based data management.
ml: Machine Learning - To optimize farming decisions.
contact: üìß Contact us for any inquiries or support!
redirecting_to_login: Error: userId is empty. Redirecting to login.
CHRS: Central Herd Registration Scheme is for registration of elite cow and buffalo breeds of national importance and provides incentive for rearing of elite cows and male calves. It plays a vital role in sourcing indigenous germplasm required for the National Project for Cattle and Buffalo Breeding. The scheme has a significant role in assisting the Department of Animal Husbandry of States and Union Territories, Private Sector and Government Undertakings in procuring elite dairy cows and buffaloes as well as bulls and progeny of high genetic potential for use in the development programme.
GAM: Retail agricultural markets in close proximity of the farm gate, that promote and service a more efficient transaction of the farmers produce across the agricultural sub-sectors, by enabling both direct sale, between the producer and consumer, and aggregation of small produce-lots for subsequent transaction, both of which can occur either physically or online
ISAM: Integrated Scheme for Agricultural Marketing (ISAM) is to provide farmers with access to competitive markets with adequate infrastructure including cold chain logistics, to enable them to realise better prices on the one hand and providing nutritious food to consumers at stable and affordable prices on the other.Central Government has been promoting creation and improvement of marketing infrastructure, capacity building and generating access to market information. These schemes have been further fine-tuned and will be continued with the objective of encouraging new technologies, promoting investment, improving the outreach of the schemes and removing constraints that hinder efficient and effective outcomes. Further, all schemes for strengthening this sector has been brought under one umbrella.
MRIN: From 2000-01, the government is working to establish a nationwide information network by providing electronic connectivity to important agricultural marketing boards and directorates. It will also collect and disseminate price and market-related data for its efficient and timely utilisation by producers, traders and consumers to derive maximum the advantage of their salesand purchases; increase marketing efficiency by effective improvement in the existing market information system; and sensitise and orient to the farmers response to new challenges in agricultural marketing by using Information Technology as a vehicle for the extension.
MSP: The Minimum Support Prices were announced by the Government of India for the first time in 1966-67 for Wheat in the wake of the Green Revolution and extended harvest, to save the farmers from depleting profits. Since then, the MSP regime has been expanded to many crops. Minimum Support Price is the price at which government purchases crops from the farmers, whatever may be the price for the crops. The MSP is announced by the Government of India for 26 crops currently at the beginning of each season viz. Rabi and Kharif. They are as follows.
MIDH: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH) is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme for the holistic growth of the horticulture sector covering fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, aromatic plants, coconut, cashew, cocoa and bamboo. The scheme integrates the ongoing schemes of National Horticulture Mission, Horticulture Mission for NorthEast & Himalayan States, National Bamboo Mission, National Horticulture Board, Coconut Development Board and Central Institute for Horticulture, Nagaland.
NFSM: In view of the stagnating food grain production and an increasing consumption need of the growing population, Government of India has launched this Centrally Sponsored Scheme, National Food Security Mission in October 2007.The Mission is being continued during 12th Five Year Plan with new targets of additional production of food grains of 25 million tons of food grains comprising of 10 million tons rice, 8 million tons of wheat, 4 million tons of pulses and 3 million tons of coarse cereals by the end of 12th Five Year Plan.
NICRA: National Innovations on Climate Resilient Agriculture (NICRA) is a network project of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). The project aims to enhance resilience of Indian agriculture to climate change and climate vulnerability through strategic research and technology demonstration. The research on adaptation and mitigation covers crops, livestock, fisheries and natural resource management. The project consists of four components viz. Strategic Research, Technology Demonstration, Capacity Building and Sponsored/Competitive Grants.
NMSA: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA) has been formulated for enhancing agricultural productivity especially in rainfed areas focusing on integrated farming, water use efficiency, soil health management and synergizing resource conservation. NMSA architecture has been designed by converging, consolidating and subsuming all ongoing as well as newly proposed activities/programmes related to sustainable agriculture with a special emphasis on soil & water conservation, water use efficiency, soil health management and rainfed area development. The focus of NMSA will be to infuse the judicious utilization of resources of commons through community based approach.
PMFBY: The new Crop Insurance Scheme is in line with One Nation ‚Äì One Scheme theme. It incorporates the best features of all previous schemes and at the same time, all previous shortcomings / weaknesses have been removed. The PMFBY will replace the existing two schemes National Agricultural Insurance Scheme as well as the Modified NAIS.Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) aims at supporting sustainable production in agriculture sector by way .
PMKSY: Government of India is committed to accord high priority to water conservation and its management. To this effect Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY) has beenformulated with the vision of extending the coverage of irrigation Har Khet ko pani and improving water use efficiency More crop per drop in a focused manner with end to endsolution on source creation, distribution, management, field application and extension activities. PMKSY has been formulated amalgamating ongoing schemes viz. Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme (AIBP) of the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development & Ganga Rejuvenation (MoWR,RD&GR), Integrated Watershed Management Programme (IWMP) of Department of Land Resources (DoLR) and the On Farm Water Management (OFWM) of Department of Agriculture and Cooperation (DAC).
RADP: Rainfed Area Development Programme (RADP) was implemented as a sub-scheme under Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY).The programme aims at improving the quality of life of farmers especially small and marginal farmers by offering a complete package of activities to maximize the farm returns for enhancing his/her food and livelihood security.
RKVY: A major cause for the slow growth in agriculture during the last few decades in India is said to be lack of adequate investment in agriculture especially public investment. Hence, the National Development Council has ratified a major scheme to raise investment in the sector at the same time by considering the agro climatic conditions and other aspects prevailing at the state and district levels. Given these problems and prospects in agriculture, the NDC has launched the Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY) in 2007-2008.Based on feedback received from States, experiences garnered during implementation in the 12th Plan and inputs provided by stakeholders, RKVY guidelines have been revamped as RKVY ‚Äì RAFTAAR - Remunerative Approaches for Agriculture and Allied sector Rejuvenation to enhance efficiency, efficacy and inclusiveness of the programme for the remaining period of the Fourteenth Finance Commission.
SSS: It is an integrated scheme that the central government has taken for the betterment of the nation. Under this scheme major social and economical issues will be covered. The New India Movement 2017-2022 envisages India free from poverty, corruption, terrorism, communalism, casteism and uncleanliness and unite the entire country by adopting good governance and using technology.
SAM: The Mission objectives are as follows: (i) Increasing the reach of farm mechanization to small and marginal farmers and to the regions where availability of farm power is low; (ii) PromotingCustom Hiring Centres to offset the adverse economies of scale arising due to smalllandholding and high cost of individual ownership; (iii) Creating hubs for hi-tech & high value farm equipments; (iv) Creating awareness among stakeholders through demonstration andcapacity building activities; (v) Ensuring performance testing and certification at designated testing centres located all over the country.
SA: Agroforestry is known to have the potential to mitigate the climate change effects through microclimate moderation, conservation of natural resources and creation of additional source of livelihood and income opportunities. In order to make agriculture less vulnerable to climatic aberrations, Government of India formulated the National Agroforestry Policy in 2014. The policy recommends for setting up of a Mission or Board to address development of agroforestry sector in an organised manner. The Sub-Mission on Agroforestry (SMAF) under NMSA is an initiative to this end. The aim of the submission is to expand the tree coverage on farmland in complementary with agricultural crops.
CMMKMK: The Chief Minister Mannuyir Kaathu Mannuyir Kaappom Scheme is an initiative launched by the Tamil Nadu government to preserve soil fertility and promote sustainable agricultural practices. Announced in the states agricultural budget for 2024‚Äì25, the scheme has an allocated budget of ‚Çπ206 crore and aims to address the declining soil health caused by excessive use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides. Through this initiative, the government seeks to encourage chemical-free farming and restore the microbial balance of the soil, ensuring long-term productivity and environmental sustainability. Key interventions under the scheme include the distribution of green manure seeds to farmers, promotion of neem tree cultivation for natural pest control, provision of vermicompost beds to enhance organic matter in the soil, and issuance of Soil Health Cards to guide farmers in managing soil nutrients effectively. The scheme is set to benefit approximately two lakh farmers in its initial phase, covering two lakh acres of farmland with an investment of ‚Çπ20 crore. By implementing these measures, the Tamil Nadu government aims to create a sustainable agricultural ecosystem that ensures healthy soil, improved farm productivity, and a safer environment for future generations.
CMSSPPS: To meet the electricity requirement of the farmers for pumping the water for irrigation, to promote Solar energy utilization, as a renewable energy in agriculture, Standalone Solar powered pumping systems is being provided to farmers with subsidy assistance. he Chief Minister Solar Powered Pump-set Scheme is an initiative by the Government of Tamil Nadu to promote sustainable agriculture by providing farmers with solar-powered irrigation pumps.his scheme aims to reduce farmers dependence on conventional electricity and diesel-powered pumps, thereby decreasing operational costs and minimizing environmental impact.nder this program, farmers are eligible for a 90% government subsidy on the installation of solar pump sets, making this technology more accessible to the agricultural community.o benefit from the scheme, farmers can apply through the Uzhavan App or by visiting the official Wbsites applications can be submitted in person at the nearest offices of the Agricultural Engineering Department.his initiative not only supports farmers in reducing irrigation costs but also contributes to the states efforts in promoting renewable energy and sustainable farming practices.
EN: e-NAM (National Agriculture Market) is an initiative by the Government of India aimed at creating a nationwide electronic trading platform for agricultural commodities. Launched in 2016, e-NAM aims to integrate agricultural markets across India to provide farmers with **better price discovery** through **online trading** and **reduce market inefficiencies** caused by intermediaries. The platform allows farmers to directly connect with buyers, traders, and agri-businesses** across the country, ensuring transparency, competitive pricing, and better market access**. Farmers can register on e-NAM and sell their produce online, facilitating seamless transactions and timely payments. The platform also provides **market intelligence** like price trends and quality standards, helping farmers make informed decisions. With the inclusion of modern infrastructure such as warehouses, cold storage, and electronic weighing systems, e-NAM ensures efficient logistics and post-harvest management. By connecting **over 1,000 mandis** in various states, e-NAM enhances the scope for nationwide trade, boosting the income of farmers and promoting the digitalization of agricultural markets.
ICAR: The ICAR-Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) Training program is an initiative by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR)** aimed at providing **practical training** to farmers, rural youth, and extension workers to enhance their agricultural knowledge and skills. The KVKs, established across India, serve as **agriculture knowledge hubs** where farmers receive hands-on training on modern farming techniques, crop management, livestock care, and agri-business practices. The training programs focus on addressing local agricultural challenges, promoting **sustainable farming practices**, and improving **farm productivity**. These centers offer specialized training in areas such as **organic farming, water management, pest control, soil fertility**, and the use of **advanced agricultural technologies** like drones, sensors, and machinery. Through **demonstrations, workshops, and exposure visits**, KVKs aim to bridge the gap between **theoretical knowledge** and **practical implementation**, thereby empowering farmers to adopt **innovative farming methods. The program also focuses on women empowerment, skill development, and increasing the income and livelihoods of rural communities.
KAVIAD: Supply of quality bud chip seedlings & less seed quantity for planting. To ensure better germination percentage & increase in yield. To increase the sugarcane production and productivity.To increase the sugar recovery.To attain overall development in Agriculture and self sufficiency in all villages of Tamil Nadu, this scheme is being implemented integrating with all the other farmers welfare related department schemes.
NADPS: To rejuvenate the existing prominent varieties. To increase the cane production and productivity. To increase the sugar recovery. For large scale production of true-to-type varieties. Rejuvenation & Rapid multiplication of new varieties. To ensure disease and pest free & genetically pure with varieties Supply of quality seedlings & less seed quantity for planting. To ensure better germination percentage & increase in yield.
NADP: The objective of National Agriculture Development Programme is to make farming a remunerative economic activity by strengthening the farmer‚Äôs effort through creation of required infrastructure that increases access to quality inputs and storage. This Centrally Sponsored scheme is implemented with a sharing pattern of 60:40 between Centre and State.
NHM: National Horticulture Mission (MIDH - NHM) National Horticulture Mission is being implemented with an objective of bringing holistic development of Horticulture sector in the State. Focused attention is given to increase the production and productivity of Horticultural crops by adopting strategies such as Promotion of hybrids, diversification of traditional cropping system into Hi-tech protected cultivation, High density planting, Rejuvenation of old senile and unproductive Plantation/Orchards, Supply of quality planting materials, Encouraging pollination through bee keeping, Development of infrastructure for Post-Harvest Management, Crop specific programmes, Intervention of suitable scientific technologies through extension functionaries etc.
NMEOP: In Tamil Nadu,National Mission on Edible Oil ‚ÄìOil Palm scheme is implementing from April 2022 onwards by Department of Horticulture and Plantation Crops . The oil palm cultivation is promoted by, making arrangements to provide quality planting materials at the farmer‚Äôs field itself at 100 per cent subsidy to the farmers through oil palm firms; During first 4 years of oil palm cultivation Rs.5,250/- per hectare is provided for maintenance and Rs.5,250/- per hectare for intercropping as subsidy. Under this scheme, 50 percent subsidy is provided to procure diesel/electric pump sets & Bore wells, oil palm protective wire mesh, oil palm cutter, Motorized chisel, chaff cutter, Aluminium portable ladder, Tractor Trolley for carrying out oil palm cultivation.
PDM: The Palmyrah Development Mission (PDM) is an initiative launched by the Government of Tamil Nadu to promote the cultivation, conservation, and utilization of palmyra palm (Borassus flabellifer), the state‚Äôs official tree. With an allocated budget of ‚Çπ3 crore, the mission aims to address the significant decline in palmyra tree numbers and revitalize its presence across the state. As part of this initiative, the government is distributing 76 lakh palmyra seeds and one lakh seedlings across 30 districts, providing them at full subsidy to encourage widespread cultivation. Additionally, a Palmyra Research Station** will be established at the Killikulam Agricultural College and Research Institute in Thoothukudi district to support research and development related to palmyra farming. Beyond ecological benefits, the mission focuses on economic empowerment, with a ‚Çπ2 crore skill development program designed to train rural youth and women‚Äôs self-help groups in creating value-added products from palmyra leaves and wood. These products, such as handicrafts and furniture, offer significant market potential and open new income opportunities. To further support farmers, the government is providing subsidies for essential tools, including harvesting equipment and climbing devices, which are crucial for efficient palmyra cultivation. By integrating environmental conservation with livelihood development, the Palmyrah Development Mission plays a key role in sustainable agriculture, rural employment, and economic growth in Tamil Nadu.Being a State tree of Tamil Nadu, to promote and enhance the cultivation of Palmyrah, Palmyrah Development Mission is implemented in all the districts.
PMFME: 'The Pradhan Mantri Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (PMFME) Scheme is a centrally sponsored initiative launched by the Government of India under the Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan to support and formalize micro food processing enterprises. The scheme aims to **enhance the competitiveness of unorganized food processing units by providing financial, technical, and business support**. With a focus on **One District One Product (ODOP), PMFME promotes **specialized food processing industries in each district, leveraging local agricultural strengths. The scheme offers a 35% subsidy (up to ‚Çπ10 lakh) on eligible project costs for **individual micro food processors** and provides **seed capital** for **self-help groups (SHGs) to strengthen their operations. Additionally, it includes skill development programs, capacity building, branding, and marketing support to improve product quality and market reach. The Ministry of Food Processing Industries (MoFPI) implements the scheme in collaboration with state governments, ensuring efficient execution. By formalizing the sector, generating employment, and enhancing value addition, PMFME plays a crucial role in boosting rural entrepreneurship and strengthening India‚Äôs food processing industry.
MI: Micro-irrigation technology is an effective technology that increases the water use efficiency by 40 to 60 percent by using water resources judiciously. This technology also increases the fertilizer use efficiency, reduces the wastage of fertilizers, controls weed growth and reduces labor cost significantly. By adopting micro-irrigation technology, the cultivated area can be greatly increased. In Tamil Nadu, the Micro Irrigation Scheme is implemented from 2007-08 onwards. Micro Irrigation is being implemented through an online portal ‡Æâ‡ÆØ‡Æü‡Æü‡Æ®‡Æ© ‚ÄúMicro Irrigation Management and Information System-MIMIS‚Äù. 100 percent subsidy is being provided for small/marginal farmers up to 2 hectares and 75 percent subsidy is being provided for other farmers up to 5 hectares.12% GST applicable on Micro Irrigation System is also absorbed by the Tamil Nadu Government for the benefit of the farmers. 65 firms have been registered through TANHODA for the implementation of this scheme. During the year 2022-23, this scheme has been proposed to be implemented in an area of 1,15,000 Ha at an outlay of Rs.960 Crore covering Horticultural and Agricultural crops.
RAD: The Rainfed Area Development (RAD) scheme, a component of the National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA), is an initiative by the Government of India aimed at promoting climate-resilient and sustainable agriculture in rainfed regions. The scheme focuses on adopting an integrated farming system that combines crops, livestock, horticulture, and fisheries to enhance farmers income while ensuring efficient use of natural resources. By encouraging water conservation techniques such as rainwater harvesting, farm ponds, and micro-irrigation, RAD helps mitigate the adverse effects of erratic rainfall and droughts. It also emphasizes soil health management through practices like green manuring, mulching, and soil testing-based nutrient management. The scheme follows a cluster-based approach, targeting selected rainfed regions to maximize its impact. Additionally, RAD promotes organic farming by supporting composting, vermicomposting, and bio-fertilizers, reducing dependence on chemical inputs. Implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare in collaboration with state governments, the scheme provides financial and technical support to farmers adopting sustainable agricultural practices. By reducing the risks associated with rainfed farming and improving productivity, RAD plays a crucial role in ensuring the long-term sustainability and economic stability of small and marginal farmers.
SHDS: To increase the area and production of Horticultural crops and to enhance the farmers income, State Horticulture Development scheme is being implemented with 100% State Government contribution at an outlay of Rs. 35.85 crore during the year 2024-25. This scheme contains components such as Area Expansion of Horticulture crops, Promotion of Hi-Tech Practices in cultivation of Horticulture crops through protected cultivation - Poly Green House, Shadenet, Hydroponics and Vertical garden to meet out the demand of vegetables in Urban areas within the limited available space,Promotion of Homestead Garden,Promotion of Intercropping through Intercropping of vegetables with cashew, intercropping of vegetables with perennial Horticulture crops, intercropping of Nutmeg with coconut plantation,intercropping of Banana with coconut plantation,Need based interventions in Horticultural crops, Establishing Cottage Mushroom units,Establishment of Garden in Educational Institutions and Orphanages and Moringa Export Zone
SMAM: Increasing the reach of farm mechanization to small and marginal farmers to improve the farm powerIncrease Farm Productivity Promote mechanization to enhance efficiency and productivity in farming.Reduce Labor Dependency Address the shortage of agricultural labor by encouraging mechanization.Support Small & Marginal Farmers Provide financial assistance for purchasing machinery.Custom Hiring Centers (CHCs) Establish CHCs where farmers can rent machinery at affordable rates.Promote High-Tech & Innovative Equipment Support adoption of advanced agricultural tools.Sustainable Farming Encourage precision farming and eco-friendly mechanization.
TNIAMP: The scheme aims to promote agri entrepreneurship in food and agri allied sector by developing their business skill set through entrepreneurship training and providing financial linkage to the individuals. All the economically viable agri related activities such as value addition, processing and packaging facilities (including primary processing). Priority will be given to projects which are eco-friendly, accord importance to energy conservation and are export oriented. The total project cost shall be the maximum of Rs.5.00 lakhs. Capital subsidy will 40% of project cost not exceeding maximum of Rs.2.00 lakhs. Promoter‚Äôs contribution is 20% of the project cost.TNIAMP is a multi-disciplinary project funded by World Bank and implemented by the Government of Tamil Nadu. The main objective of the programme is to accelerate crop diversification from crops requiring more water to high remunerative and less water requiring Horticultural crops, through promotion of hi-tech cultivation technologies. Tamil Nadu irrigated Agriculture Modernization Project is being implemented from 2018-19 to 2024-25 in 66 sub basins covering 34 districts (except Kanyakumari, Tiruppur, Nilgiris and Chennai) In crop Demonstration component the emphasis will be given to diversification of Horticulture crops like Vegetables, Fruits, Flowers, Spices and Plantation Crops. Also encouraging Pandal Cultivation, Mulching, Shade net erection, Integrated Pest Management and Micro irrigation technologies with 100% subsidy to small and marginal farmers and 75% to other farmers. In the year 2022-23, the scheme is being implemented in 54 Sub-Basins. Model village concept is being implemented in Phase I (Third year) 16 districts comprising 61 villages and Phase II (First year) 12 districts comprising 34 villages.
US: The **Uzhavar Sandhai Scheme** is an initiative by the **Government of Tamil Nadu** aimed at providing a **direct marketing platform for farmers** to sell their produce without intermediaries. Launched in **1999**, the scheme establishes **farmers‚Äô markets (Uzhavar Sandhai)** across the state, enabling **small and marginal farmers** to sell their vegetables and fruits directly to consumers at fair prices. By eliminating middlemen, farmers receive **better prices for their produce**, while consumers benefit from **fresh and affordable** agricultural products. These markets are regulated by the Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, ensuring weighing facilities, storage spaces, and drinking water for both farmers and buyers. The scheme has not only improved farmers incomes but also promoted **local food security** and strengthened **rural-urban linkages**. Over the years, the Tamil Nadu government has expanded and modernized these markets by integrating **digital payment facilities and cold storage infrastructure**, further enhancing their efficiency and accessibility. Through **Uzhavar Sandhai**, the state continues to support **sustainable agricultural marketing** and empower farmers economically.
CMIDH: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)
CNICRA: National Innovations on Climate Resilient Agriculture (NICRA)
CRKVY: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana - Remunerative Approaches for Agriculture and Allied sector Rejuvenation (RKVY-RAFTAAR)
SCMMKMK: Chief Minister Mannuyir kaathu Mannuyir Kappom Scheme
SCMSSPS: Chief Ministers Scheme of Solar Powered Pump-set
SKAVIAD: Kalaignar‚Äôs All Village Integrated Agriculture Development Programme (KAVIADP)
SNMEOP: National Mission on Edible Oil ‚ÄìOil Palm
SPMFME: Pradhan Mantri Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises
SMI: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee yojana (PMKSY) - Micro Irrigation(MI)
STNIAMP: Tamil Nadu Irrigated Agriculture Modernization Project (TNIAMP)
Tcom: These are smaller and more maneuverable, ideal for small farms, orchards, and gardens. They are often used for tasks like mowing, tilling, and light hauling. Their compact size makes them suitable for working in confined spaces.
Trow: Designed for large-scale operations, these tractors have high clearance and adjustable row spacing to work between crop rows without causing damage. They are widely used for planting and cultivating crops like maize and sugarcane.
Tspe: These are designed for specific purposes, such as orchard tractors for maneuvering around trees or compact track tractors for superior grip in wet or hilly terrains.
Tuti: These are mid-sized machines that can handle a mix of tasks, including field preparation, hauling, and attaching implements like seeders and sprayers. They are popular among medium-scale farmers due to their versatility.
Twd: Equipped with four-wheel drive, these tractors provide excellent traction and power for heavy-duty tasks such as deep plowing and operating on rugged terrains.
SSM: Moisture sensors detect the water content in the soil, ensuring optimal irrigation. They help prevent overwatering or underwatering, reducing waste and improving plant health. These are especially beneficial for water-sensitive crops like fruits and vegetables.
SSN: Nutrient sensors evaluate key elements like nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium in the soil. This data helps farmers apply fertilizers precisely, minimizing waste and maximizing crop health. Balanced nutrient levels lead to healthier, more productive plants.
SSPH: pH sensors measure soil acidity or alkalinity, crucial for optimal crop growth. Farmers use this data to adjust soil conditions to suit specific crop requirements. Proper pH levels enhance nutrient availability and plant uptake efficiency.
SST: Temperature sensors measure soil warmth to determine suitability for planting and germination. They ensure crops are grown in favorable conditions, promoting better yields. Farmers can use them to time planting for maximum growth potential.
SPB: Broadcast seeders are used to scatter seeds evenly over a wide area, making them ideal for planting grass, cover crops, or grains. They save time and effort compared to manual spreading. Suitable for large or uneven fields, they ensure efficient coverage. These seeders are often lightweight and easy to operate.
SPH: Handheld seeders are compact, manual tools designed for planting seeds efficiently and evenly. They allow precise seed placement, reducing waste and ensuring proper spacing between seeds. Ideal for small gardens or farming plots, they save time and effort compared to manual sowing. Their simple design makes them easy to use, clean, and maintain.
SPP: Precision seeders are advanced agricultural tools that plant seeds at exact intervals and depths with high accuracy. They minimize seed wastage and maximize crop uniformity, making them essential for modern farming. Ideal for high-value crops, these machines are equipped with cutting-edge technology. They help optimize field performance and resource use.
SPR: Row planters are tractor-mounted machines designed to plant seeds in straight, uniform rows. They ensure proper spacing and depth, promoting consistent growth and yield. Commonly used for crops like corn, soybeans, and vegetables, they improve planting accuracy. Their mechanized operation enhances productivity on large farms.
IMC: Center pivot irrigation consists of a long pipe mounted on towers that rotates around a central pivot. This system is highly efficient for large-scale farming, especially for crops like corn and wheat, covering vast areas with minimal water waste.
IMD: Drip irrigation delivers water directly to plant roots, ensuring efficient water use and reducing waste. It is perfect for crops like vegetables, fruits, and vineyards, where precise watering is key. This system minimizes evaporation and runoff.
IML: Lateral move irrigation systems move linearly across fields, providing even water distribution. They are ideal for rectangular fields and can be more efficient than center pivot systems for specific farm layouts.
IMSs: Sprinkler systems mimic natural rainfall and are ideal for watering large fields evenly. They come in various types, including portable units and high-tech rotating sprinklers, providing versatility for different farm sizes.
IMS: Surface irrigation uses gravity to distribute water across flat fields. It is a traditional method, most effective in areas with ample water availability, and works well for crops like rice in low-lying areas.
HTHk: Harvesting knives are sharp, serrated tools tailored for cutting crops like sugarcane, bananas, and melons. Their specialized design ensures clean cuts and improves harvesting efficiency. These knives are durable and easy to handle.
HTSc: Scythes are long-handled tools with curved blades, designed for cutting hay and clearing fields efficiently. They cover larger areas quickly compared to sickles. Skilled handling ensures effective and ergonomic use.
HTSh: Shears are handheld tools used to harvest delicate crops like fruits, vegetables, and flowers. They prevent damage to both the produce and the plant. These tools are precise, lightweight, and essential for horticulture.
HTSi: Sickles are traditional tools with curved blades, ideal for harvesting grains and cutting grass. They are lightweight and easy to handle, making them perfect for small-scale farming. Their design allows precise cutting in tight spaces.
GHG: Glass greenhouses provide excellent light transmission and durability, ideal for high-value crop production. Though expensive, they ensure consistent growing conditions, making them perfect for professional horticulture.
GHH: Hydroponic greenhouses are designed for soilless farming, growing plants in nutrient-rich water solutions. They maximize space efficiency, reduce water usage, and are perfect for high-yield, sustainable agriculture.
GHP: Polycarbonate greenhouses are lightweight, shatter-resistant, and cost-effective. They provide good insulation, making them suitable for colder climates. Their durability makes them a popular choice for year-round farming.
GHS: Shade houses use netting to protect crops from excessive sunlight, wind, and pests. These open-sided structures are cost-effective and suitable for crops requiring partial sunlight, like leafy greens and flowers.
GHT: Tunnel greenhouses, made from steel or PVC frames with plastic film, are affordable and versatile. They are ideal for small-scale or seasonal farming, offering protection from weather and pests. Their lightweight design makes them easy to install.
FB: Barbed wire fences are cost-effective solutions for enclosing livestock in large areas. They are durable but unsuitable for small or sensitive animals due to potential injuries. They are widely used in cattle and sheep farming.
FE: Electric fences are versatile and highly effective at keeping predators out and livestock in. They are ideal for large pastures and can be solar-powered for remote areas, providing a sustainable fencing option.
FM: Mesh fencing, made of woven or welded wire, offers superior security for smaller animals like poultry and rabbits. It prevents predators from entering and provides a sturdy, long-lasting barrier for smaller-scale farming.
FV: Vinyl fences are a modern, durable, and low-maintenance alternative to wooden fences. They are weather-resistant, long-lasting, and suitable for farms that prioritize aesthetics and functionality.
FW: Wooden fences are traditional and visually appealing, commonly used on farms for livestock or decorative purposes. However, they require regular maintenance, such as painting and repairs, to prevent weather-related wear.
CHH: These are a blend of conventional and rotary designs, combining the strengths of both. They offer high throughput and grain quality, ideal for large-scale farms.
CHS: These are standalone machines with an engine and operator cab, suitable for large farms. They come with advanced features like GPS guidance and auto-steering for efficiency
CHT: These are attachments used with tractors, making them a cost-effective option for smaller farms. They are versatile but have limited capacity compared to self-propelled models.
CHW: These are small, manually operated machines used for small-scale or hilly farms. They are compact and lightweight, perfect for regions where large machinery cannot operate.
ATCF: Field cultivators are large, tractor-mounted implements designed for commercial farming. They prepare wide areas of soil efficiently, reducing labor and time. They‚Äôre essential for large-scale crop cultivation and soil preparation.
ATCH: Hand cultivators are small, rake-like tools perfect for home gardens and small plots. They are ideal for loosening soil around plants, breaking up clumps, and removing weeds. Lightweight and easy to use, they‚Äôre great for precise gardening tasks.
ATCR: Rotary cultivators are mechanized tools equipped with rotating tines that dig into the soil. They are suitable for larger areas, helping to improve soil aeration and mix organic matter. These tools save time and effort in medium-scale farming.
ATHD: The most traditional type, featuring a flat blade angled to the handle, ideal for digging, chopping weeds, and breaking up soil clumps.
ATHL: A modern variation with a circular or looped blade, designed for effortless weeding and soil aeration. The loop minimizes soil disruption, making it suitable for sensitive plants.
ATHS: With a push-and-pull motion, these hoes help remove weeds just below the surface, preventing regrowth without disrupting soil structure. These are excellent for maintaining row crops.
ATHW: Equipped with a pointed, triangular blade, these hoes are perfect for creating furrows for seeds and trenches for irrigation.
ATPC: Chisel plows are designed to break up compacted soil without turning it over. This deep tillage improves drainage and root growth. They‚Äôre particularly useful for conserving soil structure in no-till farming systems.
ATPD: Disc plows feature circular blades that cut through tough, rocky soil and manage stubble from previous crops. They are effective for breaking hard ground and preparing soil for planting. These plows are perfect for rough or uneven terrain
ATPM: Moldboard plows have a curved blade that cuts into and turns over the soil, burying crop residues. This helps aerate the soil and prepare it for planting. They are a traditional choice for deep tillage in large fields
ATPR: Rotary plows use rotating blades to churn and mix soil, ideal for smaller plots. They allow for precise tillage and help in breaking up compacted layers. This modern plow ensures fine soil consistency for planting.
ATPTH: Available in manual, electric, or gas-powered versions, these tools are used for shaping hedges, shrubs, and ornamental plants. Electric hedge trimmers are favored for their precision and ease of use.
ATPTL: Featuring long handles and robust blades, loppers can cut thicker branches, often used in orchards and tree farms. They provide greater leverage, reducing manual effort.
ATPTPSa: These saws have sharp, serrated blades and are used for cutting larger branches and shaping trees. Some models are foldable for portability, while others have extendable handles for accessing high branches.
ATPTPSh: These are handheld tools used to cut small stems and branches. Bypass shears provide a clean cut, suitable for live plants, while anvil shears are designed for dry or dead branches.
ATRG: Garden rakes feature rigid tines that are perfect for breaking up compacted soil, leveling surfaces, and removing rocks or debris. They‚Äôre versatile tools ideal for preparing garden beds
ATRLa: Landscape rakes are wide and sturdy, suitable for heavy-duty tasks like grading soil, spreading gravel, and preparing large plots for planting. Their robust design makes them essential for landscaping and construction projects.
ATRLe: Leaf rakes are lightweight, fan-shaped tools designed for gathering fallen leaves and grass clippings. They are gentle on the turf, making them ideal for maintaining lawns without causing damage.
ATSSP: A specific type of shovel with narrow, elongated blades for digging deep, cylindrical holes to install posts or poles. These are highly efficient for fencing projects.
ATSSSh: These tools feature a rounded, curved blade and are particularly effective for scooping, digging, and transferring loose materials like soil, gravel, or compost. They are commonly used in preparing planting beds and filling trenches with fertilizer or manure. Specialized variants, such as snow shovels, cater to clearing large areas efficiently.
ATSSSp: Known for their straight, flat blade, spades are used for cutting through compacted soil and roots, creating neat planting beds, and digging precise holes. Gardeners often rely on spades to maintain the edges of garden beds or to lift turf during landscaping projects.
app: Apple is a nutritious and delicious fruit, rich in fiber, Vitamin C, and antioxidants, benefiting heart health and boosting the immune system.
ban: Banana is a nutritious fruit rich in potassium, fiber, and vitamins, providing energy and promoting digestive health.
cus: Custard apple, also known as cherimoya, is a sweet and creamy fruit rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, offering various health benefits.
gra: Grapes are small, juicy fruits packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals, promoting heart health and providing a natural source of energy.
gua: Guava is a tropical fruit rich in Vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants, helping to boost immunity, improve digestion, and promote healthy skin.
jack: Jackfruit is a large tropical fruit that is rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for its sweet taste and various health benefits, including improving digestion and boosting the immune system.
man: Mango is a tropical fruit rich in vitamins A and C, antioxidants, and fiber, known for its sweet flavor and numerous health benefits, including boosting immunity and promoting skin health
musk: Musk melon, also known as cantaloupe, is a refreshing fruit rich in vitamins A and C, antioxidants, and water content, helping with hydration and promoting digestive health.
oran: Orange is a citrus fruit rich in Vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants, known for its refreshing taste and health benefits like boosting immunity and supporting heart health.
papa: Papaya is a tropical fruit rich in Vitamin C, fiber, and enzymes, known for its digestive benefits, immune-boosting properties, and ability to promote skin health.
pine: Pineapple is a tropical fruit high in Vitamin C, manganese, and bromelain, known for its sweet and tangy flavor, and its ability to aid digestion and reduce inflammation.
pom: Pomegranate is a nutrient-rich fruit packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and fiber, known for its ability to improve heart health, boost immunity, and promote digestion.
sap: Sapodilla, also known as chikoo, is a sweet, tropical fruit rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants, known for its digestive benefits and ability to boost energy.
star: Starfruit, also known as carambola, is a tropical fruit rich in Vitamin C, antioxidants, and fiber, known for its unique star shape and health benefits, including boosting immunity and aiding digestion.
sug: Sugarcane is a tall tropical plant rich in natural sugars, fiber, and antioxidants, known for its ability to provide energy, promote hydration, and support digestive health.
water: Watermelon is a hydrating, juicy fruit rich in vitamins A and C, antioxidants, and water, known for its refreshing taste and health benefits like promoting hydration and improving heart health.
barley: Barley is a whole grain rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for its ability to improve digestion, regulate blood sugar, and support heart health.
bean: Beans are a rich source of plant-based protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for their ability to promote digestion, support heart health, and stabilize blood sugar levels.
lent: Lentils are a rich source of plant-based protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for their ability to support heart health, improve digestion, and stabilize blood sugar levels.
maize: Maize, also known as corn, is a rich source of carbohydrates, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for providing energy, supporting digestion, and promoting heart health.
mill: Millets are a group of highly nutritious, whole grains rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for their ability to improve digestion, regulate blood sugar, and support heart health.
oat: Oats are a whole grain rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for their ability to lower cholesterol, improve digestion, and promote heart health.
peas: Peas are a rich source of plant-based protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for their ability to support digestion, regulate blood sugar, and promote heart health.
ric: Rice is a staple grain rich in carbohydrates, providing energy, and is a good source of vitamins and minerals, commonly consumed worldwide in various dishes.
sorgh: Sorghum is a highly nutritious, gluten-free grain rich in fiber, antioxidants, and essential vitamins, known for its ability to support digestion, improve heart health, and provide energy.
whea: Wheat is a staple grain rich in carbohydrates, fiber, and essential vitamins and minerals, known for its role in providing energy, supporting digestion, and being a key ingredient in many foods.
aloe: Aloe vera is a succulent plant known for its soothing and healing properties, rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, commonly used for skin care, wound healing, and digestive health.
ashwa: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb known for its ability to reduce stress, improve energy levels, and enhance overall well-being, rich in antioxidants and various beneficial compounds.
bringa: Bhringraj is an herb known for its rejuvenating properties, often used in Ayurvedic medicine to promote hair growth, improve liver health, and reduce stress.
giloy: Giloy is an ancient herb known for its immune-boosting, anti-inflammatory, and detoxifying properties, commonly used in Ayurvedic medicine to fight infections and improve overall health.
neem: Neem is a powerful medicinal plant known for its antibacterial, antiviral, and antifungal properties, commonly used in traditional medicine to treat skin conditions, boost immunity, and detoxify the body.
shata: Shatavari is an adaptogenic herb known for its ability to balance hormones, support female reproductive health, improve digestion, and enhance overall vitality.
tuls: Tulsi, also known as Holy Basil, is a sacred herb known for its powerful healing properties, including boosting immunity, reducing stress, and promoting respiratory and heart health.
cott: Cottonseed is the seed of the cotton plant, rich in healthy fats, antioxidants, and vitamins, commonly used in cooking oil production, and known for its potential benefits in lowering cholesterol and supporting heart health.
ginge: Gingelly, also known as sesame, is a small seed rich in healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals, known for its benefits in improving heart health, supporting bone strength, and promoting skin health.
ground: Groundnut, also known as peanut, is a legume rich in healthy fats, protein, vitamins, and minerals, known for its ability to promote heart health, support brain function, and provide energy.
fmust: Mustard seeds are rich in healthy fats, antioxidants, and minerals, known for their ability to improve digestion, boost metabolism, and support heart health.
rub: Rubber seed is the seed of the rubber tree, rich in healthy fats, proteins, and antioxidants, known for its potential to support skin health, reduce inflammation, and improve heart health.
fsoy: Soybean is a legume rich in plant-based protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for its ability to support muscle growth, improve heart health, and reduce cholesterol levels.
blackpep: Black pepper is a widely used spice, rich in piperine, which has antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, known for improving digestion, boosting metabolism, and supporting overall health.
chill: Chili is a hot, spicy pepper rich in capsaicin, known for its ability to boost metabolism, improve digestion, and provide pain-relieving properties.
fcori: Coriander is an aromatic herb rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals, known for its ability to improve digestion, reduce inflammation, and support heart health.
cumin: Cumin is a spice rich in antioxidants and essential oils, known for its ability to improve digestion, boost metabolism, and support immune health.
fenn: Fennel is a fragrant herb rich in antioxidants, fiber, and essential vitamins, known for its ability to improve digestion, reduce bloating, and support heart health.
ffenu: Fenugreek is a herb rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for its ability to improve digestion, regulate blood sugar levels, and support lactation in breastfeeding mothers.
musta: Mustard seeds, when used as a spice, are rich in antioxidants and essential oils, known for their ability to improve digestion, reduce inflammation, and enhance the flavor of various dishes.
turm: Turmeric is a vibrant yellow spice rich in curcumin, known for its powerful anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, and is commonly used to improve digestion, reduce inflammation, and support overall health.
bea: Beans are a nutrient-dense vegetable, rich in protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for their ability to improve digestion, regulate blood sugar, and support heart health.
fbeet: Beetroot is a root vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, known for its ability to improve blood circulation, lower blood pressure, and support liver health.
bottle: Bottle gourd is a low-calorie vegetable rich in water, fiber, and vitamins, known for its ability to aid digestion, reduce body heat, and support weight loss.
brinj: Brinjal, also known as eggplant, is a low-calorie vegetable rich in fiber, antioxidants, and vitamins, known for its ability to support heart health, aid digestion, and promote weight loss.
cabb: Cabbage is a cruciferous vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins C and K, and antioxidants, known for its ability to improve digestion, boost immune function, and reduce the risk of chronic diseases.
cauli: Cauliflower is a cruciferous vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins C and K, and antioxidants, known for its ability to improve digestion, support heart health, and reduce the risk of chronic diseases.
drum: Drumstick, also known as Moringa, is a highly nutritious vegetable rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, known for its ability to improve digestion, reduce inflammation, and support overall health.
lady: Ladyfinger, also known as okra, is a green vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins A, C, and K, known for its ability to aid digestion, improve heart health, and support skin health.
tmush: Mushrooms are a low-calorie vegetable rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, known for their ability to boost immunity, support heart health, and provide various health benefits.
onio: Onion is a widely used vegetable, rich in vitamins C and B6, antioxidants, and sulfur compounds, known for its ability to improve digestion, boost heart health, and reduce inflammation.
potat: Potato is a starchy vegetable rich in vitamins C and B6, potassium, and fiber, known for its ability to provide energy, support digestion, and improve heart health.
pumpk: Pumpkin is a nutrient-rich vegetable high in vitamins A and C, fiber, and antioxidants, known for its ability to support eye health, improve digestion, and boost the immune system.
radd: Radish is a crunchy root vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins C and B6, and antioxidants, known for its ability to improve digestion, support liver health, and boost immunity.
ttom: Tomato is a vibrant fruit rich in vitamins C and K, antioxidants like lycopene, and minerals, known for its ability to promote heart health, improve digestion, and support skin health.
jaff: Jaffrabadi Buffalo: A large, strong breed from Gujarat, India, known for high milk production and rich, fatty milk, ideal for dairy products. They are also used in farming due to their strength.
mehsa: A medium-sized water buffalo from Gujarat, known for high milk production with rich fat content, ideal for dairy products. They are strong, calm, and easy to handle.
murr: A high milk-producing breed from Haryana and Punjab, known for its rich, fatty milk. It has a large, robust build, black coat, and forward-curved horns.
sur: A small, high milk-producing breed from Gujarat, known for moderate fat content in its milk. It has a calm temperament and adapts well to harsh conditions.
desi: Native to India, these chickens are hardy, disease-resistant, and known for their high-quality meat and eggs. They are smaller, free-range birds with varied feather colors.
giri: A hybrid breed developed in India for meat production, known for fast growth and tender, flavorful meat. It is hardy, adaptable, and ideal for both rural and commercial farming.
kadak: An indigenous breed from Madhya Pradesh, India, known for its black meat rich in protein and low in fat. It is hardy, disease-resistant, and valued for its distinct flavor and medicinal properties.
whi: A highly productive chicken breed known for excellent egg production. It has white feathers, is lightweight, and adapts well to various farming conditions.
gir: An indigenous breed from Gujarat, India, known for high milk production, rich in fat and protein. It has a distinctive white and red coat and is hardy, well-suited to hot climates.
red: An indigenous breed from the Sindh region, known for high milk production and adaptability to hot climates. It has a red or reddish-brown coat and is disease-resistant.
sahi: An indigenous breed from Punjab, known for high milk production with rich fat content. It has a reddish-brown coat and is disease-resistant, well-suited to hot and humid climates.
thar: An indigenous breed from the Thar Desert region, known for its high milk production and adaptability to harsh conditions. It has a white or light gray coat and is used for both milk and draught purposes.
kach: An indigenous breed from Gujarat, known for its strength and endurance, used for transport and farming. It has a gray or brown coat and is well-suited to hot, arid climates.
mul: A hybrid animal resulting from the crossbreeding of a male donkey and a female horse. Mules are known for their strength, endurance, and ability to carry heavy loads. They are typically sterile and used as work animals in agriculture and transportation.
spit: An indigenous breed from the Spiti Valley, known for its adaptability to cold, high-altitude climates. It produces moderate milk with good fat content and is used for milk and draught.
indian: The Indian Runner Duck is a unique, upright-standing duck known for its fast running ability. It is energetic, curious, and great at foraging. This breed is highly prolific in egg-laying and is friendly but independent. Unlike most ducks, they prefer walking or running over swimming
khaki: The Khaki Campbell Duck is an active, friendly breed known for its excellent egg-laying ability, producing up to 300 eggs a year.
musc: The Muscovy Duck is a quiet, unique breed with red facial caruncles, known for being good foragers and used for meat production. They are hardy and adaptable.
bar: The Barbari Goat is a small, hardy breed known for its high milk and meat production, fast reproduction, and good temperament.
fbeet: The Beetal Goat is a medium to large-sized breed from India, known for its high milk and meat production. They are hardy, adaptable, and have a good temperament, making them a popular choice for farming.
pash: The Pashmina Goat is a high-altitude breed known for its fine, soft wool, which is used to make luxury fabrics like Pashmina shawls. Native to the Himalayan region, these goats are hardy and adapted to cold climates.
sane: The Saanen Goat is a large, dairy breed originally from Switzerland. Known for its high milk production, the Saanen is one of the best milk-producing goat breeds. It has a calm temperament and is typically white or light cream in color.
ango: The Angora Rabbit is a breed known for its long, soft, and silky fur, which is used to make luxurious yarn and fabric. They require regular grooming due to their thick coat and are generally calm, friendly, and social animals.
sov: The Soviet Rabbit is a large breed originally from Russia, known for its high meat production and thick, soft fur. It is an excellent choice for farming due to its rapid growth, hardiness, and ability to adapt to cold climates.
twhi: The White Rabbit is a common breed known for its pure white fur. It is often used in pet keeping, research, and as a source of meat. The breed is calm, gentle, and easy to handle, making it a popular choice for families and beginners.
dec: The Deccani Sheep is a hardy and medium-sized breed native to India, primarily found in the Deccan Plateau. Known for its ability to adapt to various climates, it is primarily raised for meat production. The breed is also valued for its wool, which is used for making carpets and textiles.
marw: The Marwari Sheep is a breed native to India, specifically from the Marwar region in Rajasthan. Known for its hardiness and adaptability to harsh climates, this breed is primarily raised for meat and wool production. It has a distinct appearance, with curved horns and a well-built body.
maintenance_base: {crop} requires attention due to {disease} disease presence.
advice_sunny: Ensure sufficient watering and shade if necessary.
advice_young_plants: Pay special attention to young plants.
advice_general: Use suitable fertilizers and pest control as needed.
